sources.note: Main company page. Lists core products: EHR (Charts), RCM, Practice Management, Breeze (patient engagement), telehealth, AI tools (cirrusAI, stratusAI). States 40,000+ providers. Mentions Medsphere acquisition.

ONC mandatory disclosures page. References talkEHR as ONC-certified product. Lists CHPL ID 15.04.04.2790.Clou.02.02.1.240821. Notes integration with Surescripts, EMR Direct, MedlinePlus. CCM and RPM add-on pricing. No additional fees for base product. WCAG 2.0 AA compliant.
EHR features page. Details flexible charting, CDS, integrated order sets, unified inbox, advanced reporting, population health, quality tracking, cirrusAI Notes/Assist/Summary.

Main EHR page. Shows three separate login portals: CareCloud (Charts), talkEHR, Archivus — suggesting distinct platforms. Lists specialties: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Urgent Care, General Surgery.
Practice management page (CareCloud Central). Smart scheduling, CollectiveIQ claim scrubbing, contract management, insurance eligibility, real-time analytics, automated billing.
Breeze patient experience platform. Online scheduling, digital intake forms, two-way text messaging, automated reminders, multiple payment options, telehealth integration, remote patient monitoring.

CareCloud Community — patient engagement and collaboration tools. Secure patient portal, real-time staff chat, patient acquisition, community manager. Patients access clinical records, appointments, billing, lab results.
ONC certification page. Confirms Charts is ONC-certified. Links to Real World Test Plans, API docs, §170.315(b)(10) EHI export documentation. Three login portals: CareCloud, talkEHR, Archivus.

CareCloud Prime marketing page. Describes Prime as 'the pinnacle of EHR platforms.' $249/provider/month. AI-driven via cirrusAI, customizable templates, telehealth, lab/pharmacy integration, HIPAA-compliant.

2025 year-end review. Mentions CareCloud Prime received interoperability improvements in 2025. talkEHR got ONC certification for Critical Access Hospitals Aug 2025. cirrusAI and stratusAI launches. Medsphere acquisition closed Aug 2025.
Business.com review. 8.9/10 editor score. Highlights workflow efficiency, user-friendly interface, Breeze patient engagement, drag-and-drop scheduling.

EMRSystems 2024 review. Details four product tiers: Central, Charts, Complete, Concierge. Notes charting, e-prescribing, lab integration, billing/claims, scheduling, patient portal, secure messaging. 2024 interoperability improvements and UI overhaul.
MTBC's acquisition of CareCloud Corporation in Jan 2020 for up to $40M. CareCloud (original) served 7,000+ providers with PM, RCM, EHR, and patient experience management.
Medsphere acquisition closed Aug 2025. Adds CareVue (inpatient EHR), Wellsoft (ED), HealthLine (supply chain), ChartLogic (ambulatory EHR), managed IT. 600+ clients across 50 states.
Nov 2022 press release. CareCloud earned ONC certification for VertexDR and talkEHR, compliant with 21st Century Cures Act. Mentions Charts certification met Dec 2022 deadline.
Wikipedia article (403 error on fetch but details found via search). Founded 1999 as MTBC. IPO 2014. 16+ acquisitions. Renamed to CareCloud 2021. ~4,000 employees. HQ Somerset, NJ.
Medesk review of CareCloud. Covers pros, cons, customer experience. Notes billing system strength, practice management, patient engagement tools.
